Class BarcodeDictionaryFactory

extends java.lang.Object
    Class to create/read barcode dictionaries.

    • Field Detail

      • BARCODE_FILE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTION

        public static final java.lang.String BARCODE_FILE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTION
        Description for the current barcode file format. The barcode is a tab-delimited file with header with the following required columns: - Barcode column (BARCODE_SEQUENCE_COLUMN or BARCODE_SEQUENCE_1_COLUMN). - Sample column (SAMPLE_NAME_COLUMN or BARCODE_NAME_COLUMN). It may contain also the following columns used for include information in the read group: - Library name (LIBRARY_NAME_COLUMN). Note: order of the columns is not required.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAMPLE_NAME_COLUMN

        public static final java.lang.String SAMPLE_NAME_COLUMN
        Column header name for the sample name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BARCODE_SEQUENCE_COLUMN

        public static final java.lang.String BARCODE_SEQUENCE_COLUMN
        Preferred column header name for first barcode sequence.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BARCODE_SEQUENCE_1_COLUMN

        public static final java.lang.String BARCODE_SEQUENCE_1_COLUMN
        Column header name for first barcode sequence if BARCODE_SEQUENCE_COLUMN is not present.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BARCODE_NAME_COLUMN

        public static final java.lang.String BARCODE_NAME_COLUMN
        Column header name for the barcode name. It is used as sample name if SAMPLE_NAME_COLUMN is not present.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIBRARY_NAME_COLUMN

        public static final java.lang.String LIBRARY_NAME_COLUMN

      • fromFile

        public static BarcodeDictionary fromFile(java.nio.file.Path barcodePath,
                                         java.lang.String runId,
                                         ReadGroupArgumentCollection rgInfo)
        Gets a barcode dictionary from a file in the format defined in BARCODE_FILE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTION.
        Parameters:
        barcodePath - path to the barcode file.
        Throws:
        org.broadinstitute.hellbender.exceptions.UserException - if the file is malformed or an IO error occurs.
